Gave closing remarks for our Student Leadership Summit. My message: Think big and big things will happen! #2015SLSpic.twitter.com/Qd3RT2a3jN
Megan: "Find groups with your passions. Fine organizations with values that align with yours." #2015SLS
Student question to panel: "What are good ways to meet people in college?" #2015SLS
Jalen: "I immediately got involved to establish roots in my home away from home." #2015SLS
Megan: "Mom was sad. We created a plan to talk on the phone or text on a regular basis. Establish that communication plan." #2015SLS
Joslyn: "I got very involved in college groups to keep my mind off missing my family. I'm always staying busy." #2015SLS
My question to the panel: Talk about your first month of college. Emotionally being away from family or overwhelmed. #2015SLS
Jalen: "It's not always about learning. It's about learning to learn." #2015SLS
Jalen: "I found it helpful to set goals. Both long term and short term." #2015SLS
Question to panel: "What are some exercises or anything to help with the workload I'll have in college?" #2015SLS
Question to panel: "How did you prioritize things in college?" Megan: "Follow your passions and dreams & join clubs you enjoy. #2015SLS
Advice to students from Jalen: "My biggest piece of advice is to accept responsibility." #2015SLS
Advice to students from Megan: "Use the personal connections you make to help you in college. Building relationships is important." #2015SLS
Advice to students from Joslyn: "Take criticism and use it to better yourself." #2015SLS
Advice to students from Hunter: "Humility is the #1 leadership skill I recommend. It has gotten me pretty far in life so far." #2015SLS

(2/2) "...Use that to improve your understanding of situations to better explain them to others." @purduemitch #2015SLS
(1/2) "No matter how prepared you are, there will always be criticism..." #2015SLS
"Yes. It's always important to listen to criticism because an argument might arise that you never thought of." @purduemitch #2015SLS
Student question to @purduemitch: "Did criticism ever sway a decision?" #2015SLS
"We have to be a state who is lead by people who won't settle." - @purduemitch #2015SLS
.@purduemitch: "Keep moving forward. Don't settle for middle of the road. Look for new things that will make us a stronger, better state."
Student question to @purduemitch: "200 years of statehood. What can we do for the next 200 years to move forward?" #2015SLS
.@purduemitch on Churchill: "Remarkable combination. He never quit studying, had immense courage, and never stopped learning." #2015SLS
Student question to @purduemitch: "Who have you worked with or studied that is the best leader?" Answer: "Winston Churchill." #2015SLS
(2/2) "...They will contact you. You don't have to go brag on it. Your most valuable contacts will find you." - @purduemitch #2015SLS
(1/2) "I didn't seek out mentors as much as I should have. The best way to make contacts is to do a good job..." #2015SLS
Student question to @purduemitch: "How did you make connections?" #2015SLS
(2/2) "...you will learn so much from that, that it might position you for future success." - @purduemitch #2015SLS
(1/2) "I like trying different things. If you're willing, when an opportunity knocks..." #2015SLS
"Greater gratification comes in the form of results." - @purduemitch #2015SLS
Student question to @purduemitch: "What's your biggest motivation?" #2015SLS
(2/2) "I try to concentrate on things that didn't go well. You're human. There's a lesson to be learned." - @purduemitch #2015SLS
(1/2) "I try not to dwell on the things that went well. I'm happy and fulfilled..." #2015SLS
Question: "You've accomplished a lot. What is your biggest success?" #2015SLS
.@purduemitch now taking questions from students. #2015SLSpic.twitter.com/CqrYgD9UOB
"I didn't find 'oops' to be a hard word to say. I failed & made mistakes. You have to be prepared for the things that don't go your way."
"The right decision won't always be 100% clear. You have to learn to take chances." - @purduemitch #2015SLS
"Don't ask people to work harder than you. Don't ask them to do things you yourself wouldn't do." - @purduemitch #2015SLS
.@purduemitch on integrity and character: "People will not follow someone they don't trust. Tell. The. Truth." #2015SLS
"Read bios of great leaders and one day you might face the same challenge. You can take from that knowledge." - @purduemitch #2015SLS
.@purduemitch says learn from other leaders. "Share their formulas for success and learn from their mistakes and failures." #2015SLS
On History: "There's almost no problem you'll face as a leader that hasn't already happened." - @purduemitch #2015SLS

"English, math, science,
history. If you want to be a leader there is no way to do so w/o a basic knowledge of those fields." #2015SLS
"Congrats on being here. You're already considered leaders." - @purduemitch #2015SLS
.@purduemitch takes the stage to talk about leadership and his experiences. #2015SLSpic.twitter.com/QqCHV2bopU
Shepard Dunn tells of Peyton Manning's experience as a freshman rookie starting at UT. "When in command, take charge." #2015SLS
"You have to invest in yourself and others. Investing in yourself creates opportunities to become a better person." -Shepard Dunn #2015SLS
(2/2) "Admit your faults and mistakes. You have to learn how to say I was wrong." -Shepard Dunn #2015SLS
(1/2) "2 things on leadership: get out of your comfort zone. You don't learn when you're in your comfort zone..." #2015SLS
"You're never too old to learn. Don't stop learning. When you do, you stop growing." - Shepard Dunn #2015SLS
"Raise your hand at school, at church, in community. Say pick me, I'll do a good job." -Shepard Dunn #2015SLS
(2/2) 2nd: a little luck involved. Few people change careers and find themselves as President and CEO of a company." -Shepard Dunn #2015SLS
(1/2) "2 things that made me successful: I've taken advantage of situations presented to me..." #2015SLS
President & CEO of Bestway Express, Shepard Dunn takes the stage. #2015SLSpic.twitter.com/4eu4oYFxTl
"Success. It takes organization. Time management is important. You have to balance your time w/ school, work, dating." Prof Keegan #2015SLS
(2/2) "In high school. You've been chosen to attend this leadership summit which is a great start." - Professor Keegan #2015SLS
(1/2) "Your goals? Your dreams? How do you achieve them? It starts now. Today..." #2015SLS
Chair of Surgical Technology at @VincennesU, Prof Chris Keegan speaking about achieving success in college. #2015SLSpic.twitter.com/UQYB3qu5V7
